name: Baked Salmon with Coconut Crust
author: Ben S.
summary: Many cooks are intimidated by cooking fresh fish and, as a result, miss out on the heart-healthy, brain-boosting, omega-3 fatty acids in salmon. Never fear, though; This fast fish recipe is foolproof.
ingredients: ½ cup panko (Japanese bread crumbs, available in the Asian food aisle), or substitute dry bread crumbs
Salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste
directions: Place salmon fillets on a non-stick baking pan
In a shallow dish, combine panko, coconut, salt and pepper
Dredge each fillet in the mixture and return to baking pan
Spread leftover crumbs on top of each fillet
If desired, put under broiler until crust is golden brown
